author: Gemma Stafford
title: Blueberry Sour Cream Coffee Cake
ingredients: ⅔ cup (4 oz/115 g) dark brown sugar
½ cup (4 oz/115 g) granulated sugar
½ cup (4 oz/115 g) butter (, melted)
1 ½ cups (7 ½ oz/213 g) all purpose flour
6 tablespoons (3 oz/85 g) butter, at room temperature
¾ cup (6 oz/170 g) granulated sugar
¾ cup (6 oz/170 g) sour cream (, at room temperature)
1 ½ cups (7 ½ oz/213 g) blueberries, fresh or frozen
½ cup (2 oz/57 g) powdered sugar
⅔ cup (4 oz/115 g) dark brown sugar
½ cup (4 oz/115 g) granulated sugar
½ cup (4 oz/115 g) butter (, melted)
1 ½ cups (7 ½ oz/213 g) all purpose flour
6 tablespoons (3 oz/85 g) butter, at room temperature
¾ cup (6 oz/170 g) granulated sugar
¾ cup (6 oz/170 g) sour cream (, at room temperature)
1 ½ cups (7 ½ oz/213 g) blueberries, fresh or frozen
½ cup (2 oz/57 g) powdered sugar

instructions_list: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C) and butter and line with parchment the bottom of a 9″ (23 cm) springform pan. Set aside.
In a medium bowl, combine the flour, brown sugar, granulated sugar, cinnamon and salt.
Stir in the melted butter until the mixture clumps together. Refrigerate until ready to use.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Set aside.

Cream the butter and sugar in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment (or use a large bowl and a handheld electric mixer) on medium-high speed until pale and fluffy, about 3 minutes.
Lower the speed to medium and add in the egg, followed by the sour cream and vanilla extract and mix to combine.
Lower the mixer speed to low and stir in the flour mixture in two additions until just combined.
Spread the batter into the prepared pan.
In a medium bowl, combine the blueberries with the cornstarch and lemon zest, then sprinkle this over the cake batter.
Crumble the streusel topping over the blueberries, then bake on a rimmed baking sheet for 45-50 minutes, or until a toothpick in the center comes out clean.
Allow the cake to cool for about 1 hour at room temperature, then release the sides and transfer to a serving plate.
In a small bowl, whisk together the powdered sugar and lemon juice, then drizzle this over the cake. Let it set for about 10 minutes before serving.
Store leftovers covered at room temperature for up to 3 days.
description: My blueberry sour cream coffee cake is sweet and tangy, with a moist crumb and crisp streusel—easy and perfect for brunch or dessert.
